meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Daniel Kim Randy Woodland Julie Dock Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #1128.

td.p: Daniel Kim, a patent lawyer originally from New York City
Randy Woodland, a university lecturer originally from Baton Rouge, Louisiana
Julie Dock, an editor from Torrance, California (whose 2-day cash winnings total $24,798)

tr.td: FRANCE
"LAST" MOVIES
WARS
DANCE HISTORY
CELEBRITY BOOKS
SPELL THAT NAME

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'Alex: The poem is by George Ellis and it\'s called The Twelve Months.
JulieWhat are clouds?
$900
RandyWhat are the bells?
$6,900
DanielWhat are the 12 mos.? four seasons?
$3,200
12 months')

tr.td: POETRY
They're described as "Snowy, Flowy, Blowy, Showery, Flowery, Bowery, Hoppy, Croppy, Droppy, Breezy, Sneezy, Freezy"
Julie
Randy
Daniel
3rd place: Hotpoint refrigerator
2nd place: trip on Continental to Denver with limousine tour & carriage ride
New champion: $14,000
Julie
Randy
Daniel

16 R
(including 2 DDs),
3 W

(including 1 DD),
3 W

The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law.
